And now the GOD of Peace, that brought again from the Dead our Lord Jesus, that great Shepherd of the Sheep, thro' the Blood of the everlasting Covenant, make you perfect in every good Work, to do his Will; working in you that which is well pleasing in his Sight, thro' Jesus Christ, to whom be Glory forever and ever,

DIV1.HEAD: The CHARGE.
DIV1.P: FORASMUCH as You, by the Providence of GOD, are call'd to the Work of the Gospel Ministry, and have now declar'd your Readi∣ness to receive it of the Lord: We therefore, in the Name of our Lord JESUS CHRIST, and by Virtue of the Authority derived from Him, do, with the ancient Rite of the Laying on of the Hands of the Presbytery, constitute and ordain you a Minister of the Church of Christ; Now hereby committing unto you, the Keys of the Kingdom of Heaven; namely, the whole Administration of the Gospel of Christ, as it consists in
Delivering the Doctrines of Christ, by the preaching the everlasting Gospel;
The Administration of the Sacraments of the New-Tes∣tament;
The dispensing the holy Discipline of his Church;
And, Blessing with Authority in the Name of the Lord.
And we hereby also commit to you the pastoral Care of this particular Church of Christ, who have now requested you to take upon yourself this honourable Burden.

We therefore now Charge you, in the Presence of the Great GOD, and before our Lord Jesus Christ, the great Head and only universal Pastor of the Church, That you take heed unto the Ministry you have now received of the Lord, that you fulfill it: that you may hereafter give up your with Joy: That you be a Man of Prayer as it be∣comes a Man of GOD; that you therefore pray without Ceasing:
That you give yourself to Reading and Meditation:

That you take heed to instruct, and thereby to feed, this Flock of GOD, with Food convenient for them; endea∣vouring (the great Shepherd assisting you) to cause them to lie down in green 'Pastures, and lead them beside the still Waters, that they may be fat and flourishing.

That you therefore preach the Word of GOD in Truth; that (your Doctrine being exactly conformable to that of
the holy Scriptures) you shew Uncorruptness, Gravity, Sincerity, that thereby you may build up this Church on the Foundation of the Apostles & Prophets, Jesus Christ himself being the chief Corner Stone: That you therefore preach the Word instructive∣ly & plainly, that you enforce it strongly, that you reprove wisely and cautiously, yet with Courage and Authority, and sharply if need be, suffering no Man to despise you; that you exhort with all long suffering & sweetness of Affection; & that and in all, you study to approve yourself to GOD & to your own Conscience, a Workman that needeth not to be ashamed.
That you administer the Sacraments of the New Testament;
Baptism to visible Believers and their Seed;
The Lord's Supper to such as are of a regular Behaviour in Life, and are able (examining themselves) to discern the Lord's Body
That you dispense the Discipline of the Church of Christ with all Courage, Discretion and Impartiality, fearing the Face of no Man, nor having any Man's Person in Admira∣tion because of Advantage.

Moreover, We Charge you that you teach and in∣struct this People by your Example as well as by your Doctrine, that you always (setting before you our Lord Jesus Christ as the great Pattern of your Life & Conversation) behave yourself in all Sanctity of Manners; in all Things shewing youself a Pattern of Good Works, which cannot be condemned, that he that is of the contrary Part may be a∣shamed, having no evil Thing to say of you. That you ex∣ercise yourself to Piety and Devotion towards GOD, and Love and Charity towards these your Brethren, thereby greatly recommending the Doctrines of our Lord and Sa∣viour which you shall preach, that others seeing your good Works may glorify our heavenly Father. And for your En∣couragement to be watchful in all these Duties of your Ministry, we declare unto you. That if you shall faithfully keep this Charge, if you shall thus take heed to yourself and to your Doctrine, and to the Flock over which the Holy Christ hath now made you an Overseer, you shall both save yourself and them that hear you. If you shall be thus wise, you shall hereafter shine as the brightness of the Firmament, and as a Star forever and ever; for then when our Lord Jesus Christ shall appear, you shall also appear with Him, attired with a beautiful and a glorious Crown, Whose Lustre shall never fade away.

DIV1.HEAD: The Right Hand of FELLOWSHIP.
DIV1.P: AS the thrusting forth Labourers into His Har∣vest, is to be ascribed to the Care, Grace, and Faithfulness of the Lord Jesus Christ, the so∣vereign Head of the Church; so there is a wonderful Wisdom, Goodness and Conde∣scention discovered in the Order and Manner wherein this is done by Him: He having vested his Churches with a gracious Liberty of chusing, from amongst those, whom the Head of Influences, has raised up, qualified, and disposed to that sacred Employment, such, as upon their sincere and ardent Addresses to Him for Direction, and the Exercise of their own best Judgment and Discretion, they shall think most likely to promote the great Ends of GOD's Glory, and the Good of precious Souls, in the midst of them.

That the Churches of Christ are by Him vested with this Liberty, and indulg'd this Privilege, is evident from their Usage in the primitive Times of Christianity; and may be fairly argued even from the sacred Scriptures themselves: and particularly from Acts 14. 23. which Text rendered in our Translation, And when they had ordained them Elders in every City, is rendered by Rev Beza, Quum{que} ipsis per suffragia crssent per singulas Ecclesias Presbyteros i. e. When they had by the Susstages or Votes of the People created them Elders in every Church. And that this Trans∣lation is just, has been allow'd and pleaded by many, the best Expositors, who have understood and well considered the Import of the Word , used in the Text.

And however this Priviledge or Liberty of electing their own Pastors, has on occasion of the Abuse of it by the Churches themselves, or the assuming Disposition of those who have had the Ascendency over them, or both, been ta∣ken away from many of the Churches of our Lord Jesus Christ; the taking away whereof is, by Rev. Calvin, stiled
Impia Ecclesiae spoliatio (an ungodly robbing the Church) Yet the Churches of New England have hitherto enjoyed the quiet Possesion of it. And may it please GOD to di∣rect and enable them always so to use the same, as that they may not, by a sinful Inconsideration, Rashness, Partiality, and factious Behaviour, provoke our compassionate Re∣deemer to suffer them to be divested of it.

It is too notorious to be dissembled that in the Elections of Pastors in some of our Churches and Congregations, there has been a lamentable Loose given to Men's Hu∣mours, Lusts, and Passions; than which there can scarce be named a more awful Evidence of the Decay of vital Piety, or a more pregnant Symptom of the Withdrawings of the gracious Presence of Christ from His People. Yet, never∣theless (and to GOD's Praise be it spoken!) we have had from time to time many Instances, wherein, making the necessary Abatements for humane Frailty, this Transaction has been proceeded to and managed in our Churches, with a Seriousness and Order, agreable to the Importance of the Matter, and becoming a People so much indulg'd and highly favoured of the Lord

And it is Matter of Rejoycing to us, that we have beheld so much of the Fruits of the Spirit of Christ, in that Order, Peace, and Unanimity, with which you, our honoured and dear Brethren in Christ, have proceeded in your Choice of the worthy Person now set over you in the Lord

And having seen you now renewedly signify your De∣sires of him for your Pastor, and heard him, with an express Dependence upon Christ the glorious Head of Influences, complying with your Desires herein, and devoting himself to the evangelical Ministry; yea further, having seen him in a solemn Manner seperated or ordained to the pastoral Office, by Prayer and laying on of the Hands of the Pres∣bytery. — There can remain no imaginable Ground, whereupon to withhold from him, those Acknowledgments, Wishes Hopes and Promises, which have been wont to be express'd by the Eldership, unto such as from time to time it hath pleased our ascended Lord to add unto their Number.

Which therefore, being thereto deputed, (tho' unworthy of a standing amongst them) I shall now, in the Name of the Eldership, express, by giving you, Reverend and Dear SIR, The Right Hand of our Fellowship; hereby testifying
our Gratitude to the great Head of the Church, our Lord Jesus Christ, for those ministerial Gifts and Graces we per∣ceive to be in you; Our sincere Wishes, that they may con∣tinued, increased and multiplied upon you; and our Hopes, that you will so employ them all, as to approve yourself a Workman that need not be ashamed.

We would also hereby be understood to express our Sa∣tisfaction in your call to the Gospel Ministry, and to own and assert the Validity and Fulness of your Ordination to that sacred Office. And that thereupon we own you as a Bishop, Elder, or Pastor, in the Church of Christ, specially in this Part of it, over which, as we trust, the Holy Ghost hath now made you an Overseer; and that with hearty Love and Affection, we receive you into the Fellowship of our Ministry, and as our Equal in Point of Office.

Assuring you, That, as GOD shall enable and need re∣quire, we shall readily give you the Assistance of our Prayers and Advice from time to time, and shall always re∣joyce to see the Work of the Lord prospering in your Hands.

And now, Reverend and Dear Brother, suffer me to ob∣serve to you, That we take your thus receiving the Right Hand of our Fellowship, as expressive on your Part of the same Acknowledgments, Wishes, Hopes and Promises, to∣wards us. And may it please GOD to help you and us, to bear in Mind these mutual and endearing Engagements, for the strengthening our holy Fellowship, and not suffer them to pass away as Words of Course or an empty Formality.

Verily, SIR, from our own Experience we can assure you, the Work you are engaged in is a laborious & difficult Work: A Work wherein you must expect to meet with great Opposition: A Work therefore in order to the due Discharge whereof you must arm yourself with Patience and Resolution, always relying upon Christ, in whom all ful∣ness dwells, and remembring that you watch for Men's Souls as one that must give an Account.

And may it please our glorious Redeemer, always to af∣ford his promised Presence with you, and to cause his Grace to be sufficient for you! May you be wise to win Souls, and instrumental of turning many unto Righteousness, who may be your Hope, your Joy and Crown of Rejoycing, in the Presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at His Coming.
